main.name: David Grant
main.description: I eat, sleep and breathe React
main.bio: Hi there! I am David! My journey into coding began with the Meta Front-End Developer course, where I discovered a passion for building clean, user-friendly interfaces. Since then, I’ve been honing my skills in front-end development, with a strong focus on writing accessible, responsive, and efficient code. In addition to development, I’ve also studied the Google UX design Course and earned certifications in Google Digital Marketing and E-commerce plus Harvard's Python CS50. These experiences give me a broader perspective on creating products that not only work well—but truly connect with users. I'm excited to keep growing as a developer and contribute to meaningful, user-centered projects.

education.description: Multi-course program, featuring nine courses, that covers essential topics like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and UX/UI design. The program emphasizes hands-on experience through practical projects and a capstone project, allowing learners to build a portfolio to showcase their skills.

work.title: Founder and CEO
work.description: Cloning all the apps possible. On the way to clone the world!

projects.title: Lime Scooter Clone (React Native)
projects.description: Developed a full-featured mobile application mimicking the functionality of a Lime scooter rental service, demonstrating cross-platform development and backend-as-a-service integration. The application's user interface and client-side logic were built using React Native, ensuring compatibility across both iOS and Android platforms. Android Studio was utilized for development and testing. Supabase served as the comprehensive backend, handling all user authentication and likely managing scooter data. Real-time mapping and location-based services, crucial for locating and tracking scooters, were powered by the Mapbox API.

projects.title: Uber Clone (React Native)
projects.description: Created a clone of the Uber interface, with a strong focus on the user map and core ride request functionality, to demonstrate expertise in mobile development and complex Google Maps API integrations. The mobile application's front-end and user experience were built using React Native. Real-time location services, route planning, and destination suggestions were powered by a suite of Google APIs, including Google Autocomplete for address input, Google Directions API for calculating routes, Google Places API for points of interest, and Google Distance Matrix API for precise distance and travel time estimations between locations. This project showcases the ability to build sophisticated location-aware applications.

projects.title: Netflix Clone (React JS)
projects.description: Built a clone of the Netflix user interface and core functionalities to practice and demonstrate full-stack web development skills. This project involved creating a dynamic front-end with React and managing complex application state using Redux. User authentication was implemented using Google Auth and Firebase, where clicking on a link would direct users to a dedicated sign-in/sign-up page. Movie and TV show data were fetched from the TMDB API. The application also integrated Stripe Checkout for payment simulations, handling secure transactions and processing payment events via Webhooks, likely utilizing Firebase's serverless capabilities; the profile icon allows users to select a plan but it's a demo account on Stripe. The entire application was deployed and hosted on Netlify.

projects.title: Airbnb Clone (React JS)
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive clone of the Airbnb frontend, emphasizing product display, interactive search, and user interaction flows. The project leveraged a modern web development stack, utilizing React for building dynamic user interfaces within a Next.js framework, which provided server-side rendering capabilities for enhanced performance and SEO. Core styling was handled with HTML and CSS, augmented by JavaScript for interactive elements. Key features included an intuitive calendar date picker for booking availability and seamless integration with the Mapbox API to display property locations. The entire application was deployed and hosted on Vercel, demonstrating proficiency in modern web deployment pipelines.

projects.title: Little Lemon Restaurant (React JS)
projects.description: Completed during Meta Front-end developer certificate for Capstone project.Built using React. Fully responsive with table booking fucntionality. Deployed on Netlify. The project showcases a restaurant booking system with a user-friendly interface, allowing customers to make reservations. The application is designed to be fully responsive, ensuring a seamless experience across devices. It utilizes React for dynamic rendering and state management, providing an interactive user experience. The project is hosted on Netlify, demonstrating proficiency in modern web deployment practices.

testimonials.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
